text: i started lots of chatter around cubby prototype and moving to 811 - who is wrangling the larger: "what to do with existing prototypes" conversation?  I'd like Joel and I bolted on to talk existing Google stuff.
what other existing prototypes do we have besides brandlab wall + gnc stuff?
The sand music prototype (name escaping me)
sommely
sandbox? not coming with us. sommely stuff will need to be moved by us by hand. they will get a war room
well, if we're down to just the Google stuff, does that fall into War Room committee, another or create a need to spin up it's own team? (likely me, Joel, Josh)
i say let’s spin up it’s own team so you can coordinate that Dennis seeing as you understand the needs of the related projects. sound cool?
into it
will add to avery's sheet
thank you dennis!!!!! :raised_hands::skin-tone-2:
what about the thumbs-up-smile thing and the gong? (and hoping this was actually thought of already, but the sign?)
gong 2.0: air horn
my understanding of the thumbs up smile thing and the gong is that they can just be put into a box and moved
what is “the sign”
the uncorked sign outside of mountain
the uncorked logo/color sign in social space
you know, the thing that never works quite right? :slightly_smiling_face:
ahh, thought you were talking “Make Cool Shit” sign
my bad
well no one maintains the logo sign and it’s only been turned on once in the last year that I know of. my thought there is that if we don’t use something we shouldn’t be moving it.
the make cool shit neon sign is moving with us.
but we need constant reminders that hardware is hard and keeping a demo running forever is an insurmountable task
it’s an hour’s worth of work to get that sign to just light up orange when we give it power
if people want it around we should make it real dumb
rip out all the voice stuff
It doesn’t need to be fully IOT-connected. It just needs to light up the right color.
it is pretty when it works

it is pretty when it works!  if anyone can volunteer to maintain it or figure out a more permanent working state for it, we can discuss a place for it at the new building. Also, they way its plugged in now with a few extension cords is currently a fire hazard so that will need to be addressed if we move it.
I think Josh and I can volunteer to make it dumb with our lighting experience.
Would make it much more reliable and it shouldn't take too much time to get it set up.
Easier than setting it up for voice...
when you do the update, would you please check all the code into the uncorkedSign repo on Bitbucket so we can all maintain it?
<https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/uncorkedsign/overview>

attachments.title: Bitbucket
attachments.text: Bitbucket is a Git and Mercurial based source code management and collaboration solution in the cloud. Bitbucket is simple and powerful, enables code collaboration for teams, works with the tools that matter, and is easy to use even for teams new to Git and Mercurial
